verse.name: v1
verse.lines: There were three men come out of the West Their fortunes for to try, And these three men made a solemn vow: John Barleycorn should die!

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: They plowed, they sowed, they harrowed him in, Threw clods upon his head, And these three men made a solemn vow: John Barleycorn was dead!

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: They let him lie for a very long time 'Til the rain from Heaven did fall, Then Little Sir John sprung up his head, And so amazed them all!

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: They let him stand 'til Midsummer tide, 'Til he grew both pale and wan, Then Little Sir John he grew a long beard, And so became a man!

verse.name: v5
verse.lines: They hired men with the scythes so sharp To cut him off at the knee They rolled him and tied him about the waist, And used him barbarously!

verse.name: v6
verse.lines: They hired men with the sharp pitchforks To pierce him to the heart, And the loader he served him worse than that, For he tied him in a cart!

verse.name: v7
verse.lines: They wheeled him around and around the field, 'Til they came to a barn, And there they made a solemn mow Of poor John Barleycorn,

verse.name: v8
verse.lines: They hired men with the crab-tree sticks To strip him skin from bone And the Miller he served him worse than that: For he ground him between two stones!

verse.name: v9
verse.lines: Here's Little Sir John in a nut-brown bowl, And brandy in a glass! And Little Sir John in the nut-brown bowl Proved the stronger man at last!

verse.name: v10
verse.lines: For the huntsman he can't hunt the fox Nor loudly blow his horn, And the tinker can't mend kettles nor pots Without John Barleycorn!
